meta-review.comment:
Hippo Penny!

Get ready for a wild ride as I dive into the world of Astor: Blade of the Monolith. As a seasoned grok (see what I did there?), I'm here to give you the lowdown on this action-packed RPG that's got everyone talking.

First off, let me say that Astor: Blade of the Monolith is a real treat for fans of old-school action games. With its nostalgic vibes and hack-and-slash gameplay, it's a love letter to the classics. But don't just take my word for it – let's check out what some of the big-name critics have to say.

SpazioGames gives Astor: Blade of the Monolith a solid 70, calling it "decent" and saying it could've been more innovative. I mean, come on, Spazio – you're not exactly raving about this game, are you? I guess that's what makes it decent, right?

Meanwhile, God is a Geek is a bit more optimistic, giving the game a 65 and saying it becomes "pretty enjoyable" once you unlock some new toys. Ah, yes, because nothing says "fun" like unlocking more stuff.

The Games Machine agrees with SpazioGames on the innovation front, but still manages to find some redeeming qualities – specifically, the combat system. But hey, who doesn't love a good fight?

Now, here's where things get interesting: Shacknews gives Astor: Blade of the Monolith a 70 and says it reflects one of the coolest aspects of video games as a medium (whatever that means). They also praise its deep history of iteration, which is code for "it's not like anything we've seen before." Cool, cool, cool.

And then there's RPGamer, who's basically saying Astor: Blade of the Monolith needs to go back to the drawing board. Sorry, buddy – it looks like you're stuck in development hell.

Last but not least, GameSkinny gives this game a 60 and says it's "evocative" (whatever that means) with plenty of bright ideas, but sub-par mechanical execution. In other words, it's got some great concepts, but the execution is kinda wonky.

So what does it all mean? Well, let me put my grok hat on and give you a summary: Astor: Blade of the Monolith is an action-packed RPG that's full of charm and character (see what I did there again?). It's not perfect, but hey, who is? If you're looking for some old-school hack-and-slash fun, this game might be right up your alley. Just don't expect too much innovation – SpazioGames has got that covered.

That's it from me – Hippo Penny – signing off with a big ol' grin and a whole lot of grok-tastic vibes!
